xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels
Class HybridKernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.functions.AggregationFunction<List,HybridKernelCDF>
      xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels.HybridKernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class HybridKernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction
extends AggregationFunction<List,HybridKernelCDF>

In the context of online aggregation, running aggregates are built. Given an iterator of data, an Aggregator computes iteratively aggregates. For instance, the current maximum of the already processed data is determined. An internal aggregation function processes the computation of the new element by consuming the old aggregate and the new element from the input cursor. Generally, each aggregation function must support a function call of the following type:
agg_n = f (agg_n-1, next).
There, agg_n denotes the computed aggregation value after n steps, f represents the aggregation function, agg_n-1 the computed aggregation value after n-1 steps and next the next object to use for computation.
This class implements an aggregation function that computes hybrid kernel based density estimators or hybrid kernel based cdf estimators. There, the data is processed in blocks of a predefined size. Given such a block of data, a hybrid kernel based estimator is established. For determining parameters required for the computation of the bandwidth, also the variance, the minimum and the maximum are iteratively computed. Thus, given an input iterator, this hybrid kernel based block estimator aggregation function computes a new hybrid kernel based estimator with the corresponding parameters for a new data block. Concerning the change points, a predefined function computes them for the current block.
Consider the following example that displays a concrete application of a hybrid kernel based block estimator aggregation function combined with an aggregator: 

        Aggregator aggregator =
                        new Aggregator(
                                HybridKernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction.inputCursor(cursor, blockSize),
                                new HybridKernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction(
                                        Function estimatorFactory, 
                                        new BiweightKernel(), 
                                        int bandwidthType, 
                                        Function changePointsAggregateFunction
                                )
                        );

See Also:
Aggregator, AdaptiveAggregationFunction, HybridKernelCDF, KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

HybridKernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction

public HybridKernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction(Function estimatorFactory,
                                                          KernelFunction kf,
                                                          int bandwidthType)
Constructs a KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction. The factory for building the block estimators, the kernel function and the bandwith type are given.

Parameters:
estimatorFactory - factory constructing the estimators
kf - used kernel function
bandwidthType - used bandwidth strategy

HybridKernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction

public HybridKernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction(Function estimatorFactory)
Constructs a KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction. The factory for building the block estimators is given. Concerning the kernel estimators Biweigth kernel functions and the normal scale rule for the bandwidth are used.

Parameters:
estimatorFactory - factory constructing the estimators

HybridKernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction

public HybridKernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction()
Constructs a KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction. The factory for building the block estimators returns hybrid kernel based density estimators. Concerning the kernel estimators Biweight kernel functions and the normal scale rule for the bandwidth are used.

Method Detail

accessValue

public static Function accessValue(int type)
Returns the current variance, maximum or minimum of the wrapped input iterator in accordance to the defined type.

Parameters:
type - indicates whether variance, minimum or maximum has to be returned
Returns:
current variance, maximum or minimum

inputCursor

public static Cursor inputCursor(Iterator input,
                                 int blockSize,
                                 Function changePointsAggregateFunction)
Constructs a cursor that builds data blocks and online aggregates for a given iterator. Namely, the variance, the minimum and the maximum are iteratively computed respectively estimated. Generally, the aggregator delivers data blocks of a predefined size and the estimated variance, minimum and maximum.

Parameters:
input - input data delivered by an iterator
blockSize - size of the blocks
changePointsAggregateFunction - function delivering iteratively the corresponding change points
Returns:
a cursor delivering Objects of type Object[] containing:
0. last seen n objects
1. estimation of the variance of the whole data
2. minimum of the previous data
3. maximum of the previous data
4. function delivering iteratively the corresponding change points

invoke

public HybridKernelCDF invoke(HybridKernelCDF old,
                              List next)
Two-figured function call for supporting aggregation by this function. Each aggregation function must support a function call like agg_n = f (agg_n-1, next), where agg_n denotes the computed aggregation value after n steps, f the aggregation function, agg_n-1 the computed aggregation value after n-1 steps and next the next object to use for computation. This method delivers only null as aggregation result as long as the aggregation has not yet initialized. As result of the aggregation a hybrid kernel based block estimator, that relies on the current block, is returned.

Specified by:
invoke in class AggregationFunction<List,HybridKernelCDF>
Parameters:
old - result of the aggregation function in the previous computation step
next - next object used for computation
Returns:
new kernel based block estimator

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
